tr.td: Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less)

value.displayName: CONCUSSION WITH BRIEF LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS

translation.displayName: Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less)

code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

observation.value: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

td.content: s:white m aged 55 ys presents with mild vomiting since hitting the front of the head a short time ago. he also reports severe headache, moderate nausea, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the mild vomiting. he had LOC 27 min. o:Height 67 in, Weight 172 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 61, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 18, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

content2.Unmatched: , CT Head ( - ) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive
ICB , MRI Brain Unremarkable , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex , appears

Value.Value: CT Head , MRI Brain , and performed E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

content2.Value: CT Head , MRI Brain , and performed E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

td.content: s:white M aged 55 ys presents for approx. one (1) week f/u after sustaining a mild concussion (LOC 27 min). he denies vomiting, headache and nausea since the accident. he has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). he has resumed usual state of function. o:Height 67 in, Weight 172 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 62, SystolicBP 114, DiastolicBP 75, Respiration 18, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=97,Visual Memory=96,Processing Speed=43.0,Reaction Time=0.49, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex ,

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination

td.content: Do not IV Fluid and Support
